name: Arena Stage at the Mead Center for American Theater

html_attributions: Arena Stage at the Mead Center for American Theater

reviews.text:
Had a fabulous date with my husband on a weekday evening seeing a heartwarming romantic comedy, "Holiday".  We had several good laughs and were completely invested in the drama. It's definitely a holiday escape, and It's a must-see!

The play was staged on The Fichandler Stage, an epic, four-sided auditorium, with steeply raked seating tiers with bold, earthy exterior design. Audience members are never more than eight rows away from the action. The cast came out from all corners of the stage and even from below! And what's a show without a trapeze? :)

During the intermission, I had one of their specialty drinks, Anita's Flowers, and my husband had The Mary Pickford, Jr. a non-alcoholic drink. They were both surprisingly very good. I highly recommend ordering any drinks or snacks in advance. "Holiday" has two intermissions but they are only 10 minutes each!

Absolutely beautiful and has magnificent architecture. Upstairs had an overlook where you can see the DC streets. So definitely arrive a little before your show to enjoy this experience as well.

Paid street parking, as well as garage parking, are available.

Loved my experience to see The High Ground at the Arena stage. Their parking garage was $27. This venue was larger than expected. There were multiple shows happening at the same time. I recommend getting here 35-40 mins before the show to enjoy the concession because no food/drink allowed. Masks are required for the duration of the show.

Had an amazing time as a cool friend date during the amazing American Prophet show. I'm the type that loves historical pieces that are about real people who made a difference. It's especially important for me to support productions showcasing true POC talent with amazing vocals the draws heart wrenching emotions. I especially loved the depiction of President Lincoln in a more critical light than we're used to.

Cornelius Smith Jr. was a star in his lead role as Fredrick Douglass (with two S's!) But my absolute favorite character was Anna Murray Douglass played by Kristolyn Lloyd. Really felt the genuineness of her performance and she shined throughout.

I will have to definitely come back to the Arena Stage for more performance and I sincerely hope you come back as well.

Pro tip: intermission is really quick so consider just bringing your own bottle of water to drink outside the theater during break.

What a great theater. Love the huge variety of shows they offer with fabulous casts!! Some are fun and some make you think about the world we live in, both past and present. The musicals are the best! ❤️🎭❤️

I am rating the location primarily based on the fact that I was informed MASKS are required inside the theater upon arrival at the theater.  I was unaware of this requirement before purchasing a ticket and did not notice anything related to these requirements on their website.  I find this incredibly ridiculous when masks are not required in the city nor on planes to enter the city.  I have no issue with those who choose to wear a mask, however I would like to have the same choice to not patronize locations that infringe upon my personal freedoms and dictate their own policies outside of city regulations.

Fine Dining! Initially I misjudged The Capital Grille as a normal place to get a burger sure to the word Grille being part of their name. However the reviews said otherwise. My wife and I went and were pleased to find they offer a romantic fine dining experience with an excellent menu. My wife ordered the Double Cut Lamb Rib Chops and loved them. The added mint made them something extra special. I ordered one of the bone in steaks and wasn't disappointed. The size of my steak was more than what I could eat and it was cooked just right. I recommend The Capitol Grille for anyone passing through who wants an excellent meal.

Absolutely wonderful! The new location is great and the inside is very nice with fun artwork. We celebrated Mother’s Day and had an excellent meal and our server, Miguel was so friendly and accommodating! He made the experience great. The food was delicious and the favorites were the filet & lobster tail, lobster mac and cheese and Brussel sprouts! For dessert, the cheesecake was amazing! We will be back for the next celebration!

We went for dinner tonight to celebrate our anniversary, and had THE best meal. I had the steak and lobster tails, my spouse had the bone-in ribeye. Everything was very well seasoned and flavorful, our steaks had the perfect temperature we had asked for, great experience. Our waiter was the best part of the night, Carlos, he was so so very helpful and friendly, we made friends with him. He made sure we had a great experience. Loved everything about this place!

I proposed to my girlfriend here and it was the best service here. The steaks were good, the waiters was a good person, the wine was good, and the soup too. After I propose, we got really good tasting desert. Be prepared to spend money, but it is worth the price. I hope to go there again for our future wedding anniversary.

Recommend making reservations if visiting on a weekend. Had a great time service was  wonderful they were able to accommodate 2 more seats for our party, even on a busy night. Entrees are a la carte good section of sides, not so much for desert, but they have a  nice wine list.

name: Fiola
vicinity: entrance on Indiana Ave, 601 Pennsylvania Avenue Northwest, Washington

reviews.text: Stepping into Fiola is stepping into refined and elegant world. Every detail in this place  oozes with taste, warmth and elegance. The menu is rather limited but the dishes are carefully and artistically made. Mason our waiter was amazing. Thank you for a pricy yet wonderful experience.

THANK YOU Fiola for making my birthday so lovely and special! An experience and memories I’ll always cherish! THE MOST amazing food, you simply have to stop here while in DC.
Wonderful service from the moment you walk in. Our server, Mason, was highly knowledgeable about the wine list and very personable as well. Each course was beautifully crafted, it’s clear how much work and dedication went into each and every aspect of dinner. Thank you again Chef Fabio and the entire Fiola team!

So far the best michelin tried in the DMV area. From making modifications to my large party to the modification for me of no sheep's milks, which ended up modifying multiple courses, this restaurant was above accommodatable and amazing. First I'd have to give a shout out to the management staff, Sarah S was so helpful and nice and has a great demeanor, and Giuseppe was also amazing and assisted us with ending our bills and making white truffle recommendations. We tried the 9 course option which everyone raved about. 1 felt if we went for the 5 course, maybe it would have been a different experience and a few did not like the citrus flavor for the lobster entree meal, but every other course was so amazing. I'd recommend for sure to add on the white truffle and gnocchi pasta course as it was the highlight of everyone's night, as was the tiramisu. Definitely a place to visit again (this being said by someone who doesn't normally eat Italian food either!). Thank you Fiola!

Without a doubt the best meal I've ever had. I went a couple of years ago while in DC for a conference. I had some sort of prefixed chef's tasting menu that had 7 or 8 courses, all paired with wine. it was amazing and I can't wait to go back.
The first course was almost too much for me to try. I usually don't eat raw meat, and the first course was a raw oyster topped with wagyu beef tartare, then topped again with caviar. While I was not used to the texture, the flavor was absolute art.
The seafood, meat, sides, sauces, all the way to the garnish was all masterful and delicious.
It took several people to create, present, and deliver the meal to the table. It was like watching a show unfold. The server was very knowledgeable about everything served and we were lucky he was also a sommelier. This made it even more interesting as he presented the wine that was served with each course.
I can't recommend this place enough. It was just honored as the #2 Italian restaurant in the world that's outside of Italy. Do yourself a favor and go ready to spend whatever it takes to get the full experience.

Dinner here was exceptional. Service staff was amazing. We did the harvest menu where you get to pick 4 items yourself and the chef picks the others for you. We had not one complaint. Every dish was delicious. Some of our favorites were the Eggplant Mousse, Langoustine, Childhood(Pasta), Farmers Steak(Wagyu)& the Sweet Beginnings(Pumpkin Spice "Latte," Honeynut Squash Gelato). It felt like by the end of the night we must of had 15+ dishes. Oh and the cocktails! Such an experience. Highly recommend ordering their specialty cocktails. It is like nothing you’ve experience before! Super creative & fun. Needless to say, you definitely get your moneys worth and will not leave hungry or unhappy. It was an amazing experience and we can’t wait to go back next time we’re in D.C.!

We tried the set menu and so worth it. The food is great, and the chefs present Indian food with a modern take but still keep the amazing authentic flavors in the dishes. But the service is hands down the best in town. The staff are very professional, friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming, especially Gustavo who we had a pleasure to met with during our first dinner experience in Rasika a couple of days ago. It’s always a bit competitive to get a table there but a must go to restaurant in DC, especially if you love food with a lot of flavors

LOVE this place! The food is great, the staff is great, ambiance is great. The dishes are a modern twist in terms of flavors, textures and appearance. Yet still heavily connected to the inspiration, so you will know what you are eating. Our favorite was the palak (spinach) dish. Could not take a photo as we were hungry and just dug into the food. The Naan (bread) was like a buttery cloud you would want to sleep on. If you dine-in, you can get multiple small portions of the entree to try out different menu options, which is what we did. We loved the food so much that we ate here 4 times out of our 3 day stay in the area!

Excellent Indian restaurant. Whenever I come to Washington DC, Rasika is on my stop list. Last 5 years, I have not had any bad dishes. You can order anything from the menu and it will taste delicious.

I have been wanting to visit here for several years. I wanted to get the tasting menu, but I went with someone who is non veg, so I tried 4 vegetable side curries and the bread basket instead. Asparagus was very good. Eggplant was tasty, but a bit too spicy for my liking. Malai kofta had delicious dumplings, but the sauce was bitter. Zucchini fritters were very dry, but the curry was excellent. I ended up eating just the sauce with the bread. Breads were all great. Service was fantastic. Loved the inside ambiance, the patio space, and the silverware.

The best Indian food I have ever had, do not forget to order/specially go there for the Gujarati lasagne (it literally blew my mind by how balanced and wholesome it was!). Their purple potato dosa was a family favorite. The staff was very sweet and loving and the service was fast and great.

Station 4 is a great place for Sunday Brunch with friends. My recent encounter was electrifying and refreshing. The food was really good, and the cocktails were good as well. There was a DJ playing music and accepting music requests from patrons. I was so anxious when I received my food, I almost forget to take a picture. However, I did capture a picture before finishing my meal. I would definitely recommend this location. My only suggestion is for you to call and make a reservation prior to arrival because the restaurant fills pretty fast and you may not have a chance to be seated if you don’t have one.

Went here for a Christmas Eve brunch and we loved it! The food great and drinks were good (strong😏)…. Maybe because it wasn’t busy lol. My favorite was the duck fries but overall their were tasty and good portion size. The metro (water front-green line) is right across the restaurant and parking garage is right around the corner.

ok had the Duck Fat Fries. They were crispy and good. Tried the watermelon steak salad... it's a winner SANS the ranch dressing( get vinaigrette). All the food was fresh and beautifully prepared.  Best stuff Salmon with crispy skin. Angel was my waiter and he was nice and patience. Nice ambience, for me easy parking. I'm coming back for happy hour.

Brunch was pretty good. The atmosphere is cool and some of the servers were on point, others not so much.  I had to send my steak and eggs back because I couldn't cut the steak, and I was using a steak knife.  I sent that order back (which I hate to do), and got the shrimp and grits instead. It was really good, tasty, and well seasoned. To go with our meal we had a bottle of Prosecco, an Irish coffee, and some tequila shots.
There was no music or any extra frills, but it was a decent brunch.

Good service and great food. I booked my reservation on OpenTable. The table was ready when we arrived. The servers was nice and attentive to our needs. The food came out quickly and it was hot! The bathroom was well stocked and clean. Parking was available on the street.

The service here is quick and friendly staff. Our host was excellent and give us some brief explanations and suggestions what to order. She did not rushed us when we order. Although it was a bit of wait to get a table for 6 person, it was worth the wait. Food were delicious and authentic Mexican. Prices are reasonable. Will come back here for our next DC visit.

Enjoyed dinner. Loved the fun energetic atmosphere. We made reservations here for dinner. Loved that the chips and salsa were complimentary and placed on our table when we sat down. The guacamole was really good. I had the enchiladas and my husband had a chicken taco and a beef taco. Everything was good. Service was great.

My family and I traveled from Atlanta and while walking around DC we came across this gem. Our server was Joanna and she was great at taking care of us and made us feel comfortable! Had knowledge on any questions we had, which was a plus! We were beyond pleased with the food, drinks, desserts and the pleasant atmosphere!!!
Definitely went above and beyond our expectations, with great authentic Mexican dishes. We couldn’t have been happier, we look forward to coming back in the future! Greatly recommend!!! It’s a must try.

The food is quite tasty. When we visited, though, the service was a bit uneven. The food seemed to rush out, but our server would disappear for long stretches. We highly recommend the guacamole. It was yummy, but we ordered it spicy and it came out mild. The chips and salsa were excellent.  We also had t cevice and Vera Cruz tuna tacos.  Both were great.

Definitely worth a visit. We had a great evening here. The server was kind and friendly. The food was amazing. They bring you warm chips and salsa, which are great. We tried two different margaritas. The Serrano Margarita was a spicy delicious kick in the face :) The Al Gusto was good as well. All 3 tacos were excellent. Really well done. And the place feels reasonably priced. The decor is super eclectic and fun as well, butterflies everywhere. We would highly recommend this place.

We love Hill Country and the food is consistently good each visit. One caveat for this visit though, I remember the Mac and cheese being a lot better than what it was this particular evening. It was still good but maybe it wasn’t as good as I remembered. There was a hockey game in the city tonight and this was a good treat before game time. The restaurant had good seating and the bar area had plenty of seats left. Overall I really enjoy the food and would go back for sure!

Get transported to a wild west canteen with good food. Yeah why, not. I'll take it. The atmosphere is really nice and relaxed. The canteen style actually works and is efficient, so you get the food from the counter and sit anywhere you like. The meat was good, roughly what I expected. So I can't complain. The price might be a bit high for what it is. I'm giving 5 stars because with the potential of live music, this place has potential and can be very lively.

Now this is BBQ!! I was a bit concerned when my pal said DC had good BBQ, but after this visit, I owed him a “you were right!” Big spaces, nice tables and a full bar. The food was just amazing. Friendly staff and we never went without our glasses full. Somehow I was able to eat a whole brisket sandwich, beans with burnt ends, and two cornbread muffins. This was the best food I had in DC the whole week.

Great Texas BBQ in the heart of DC.  The service here is topnotch.  We were greeted warmly and shown to a table right away.  We were also asked if we had dined at Hill Country before and when we said we had not, the hostess politely informed us of how the ordering process works, which was really helpful.  The staff preparing the meat were friendly and engaged us in conversation while they prepared our plates.  There are several types of meat to choose from....brisket, sausage, chicken, etc.  All were really good.  The chicken was more moist than almost any other bbq place I have visited in DC and Texas.  They have every side you can think of as well.  I highly recommend the bourbon mashed sweet potato, chili, and deviled eggs.  The cornbread is pretty good too....honey butter is delish.  They offer margarita pitchers, which are really good, just be sure to sit in the bar area if you want to take advantage of the happy hour specials.  They also have another large dance club space in the basement, where it looks like they have live bands.  Overall, we had a great time and would comeback.  Thanks!

First-time eating here and let me tell you it won't be the last. The food was amazing the brisket was moist, the chicken was good, and the ribs amazing. The side was good to the mac and cheese, sweet potatoes, and greens. Some of the best BBQ I had in a while.

They helped us accomplish our mission of grabbing some quick drinks and apps. We were served just as we sat and everything came out with the quickness.

Looks like the pitch-perfect (pun intended) place to watch "the game". Plenty of screens. Even "LooTubes" for when their brews break the seal.

The Nashville Hot Honey sauce I ordered for my Chicken Wings didn't quite supply the amount of spice I expected, but they had the oven-crispiness that was advertised and I did enjoy them.

I was exhausted after a full day walking doing tourist stuff and needed a place to recharge near the National Mall. I found this place and was pleasantly impressed. Good bar menu, (Don’t expect more). Soft Pretzel bites were OK but seemed like they were previously frozen. The Cheese Curds were delicious though. Decent beer selection, I would definitely stop here again if I’m in the Navy/Archives/Arena area.

Dined here with the family and experience a well cooked and thoughtful staff. After sitting down we very promptly were greeted and brought waters. Shortly after the waiter asked what drinks or apps we wanted and then ordered 5 mins later. Food received during prime time in under 30 minutes which helped the kids grumpiness! A bit pricey (fries add on are $6) but overall worth it. Would return for sure.

Service was nice, location was good

BUT

I ordered Texas Roadhouse burger which comes with guacamole and jalapeños. This was why i ordered but the cook forgot to put both of them...

I realized half way eating burger and then I asked the server the ingredients were missing. She got it for me later but it was almost too late...

I can't believe the cook forgot the main ingredients in the burger..  it was super disappointing...

And there weren't apologies...
Excellent food and atmosphere! TVs everywhere even in the bathrooms. The cheese curds were the best and they gave so many. The burger was cooked perfect and very tasty!

Five stars.  Great food plenty of options.  My friend was with me, a Teaism fan for many years and she noticed a few things missing from the menu recently.   The French toast is awesome, just awesome.  Tea selection is obviously great. Outdoor seating is limited, but inside there are two levels of seating.  Vegetable kabobs are good.  Food is prepared quickly so don't be afraid to wait in line to order. Great vegetarian options.  Enjoy

Stopped in for a quick snack after visiting the National Gallery of Art. Ordered a traditional bubble tea and a Salty Oat cookie (like an oatmeal raisin). Both were excellent. The rest of the menu looked fun. There are some sandwiches and bento boxes. Want to come back!

Vegan ginger scones, beet burger, salmon binto box, and berry tea....drooling.  This is a wonderful place to eat, relax, and get out of the cold- right by the Archives metro stop.  The lady that works the cash register knows the menu inside and out.  She's  worked there for years and is super kind.

The first floor is wheel chair accessible, including the bathroom.  The basement is not.

There was a lot of sitting - the place has two floors. Their menu is kind of fun - an Asian fusion. The taste was just ok though. Not bad, but not smth to come back for. We had noodles with veggies and chicken okonomiyaki. Chocolate salted oatmeal cookie for dessert - that one was good. The place has a great selection of tees. A bit on a dirtier side when it gets busy. You order upstairs and have to wait for them to call your order.

I was walking to my car when I stumbled across this Tea shop. Atmosphere was great soon as I walked in.  I tried The lavender lemon mint  and the Korean beef brisket sandwich . It was amazing no complaints from me! I love the vibes in the shop for sure I really recommend giving this a try ! 5/5 from me for my 1st time 👍🏼

name: Pavilion Café
vicinity: The Sculpture Garden, 7th Street &, Constitution Avenue Northwest, Washington

reviews.text:
Really great food! There was a long wait during rush hour on a weekend but it is normal. I highly recommend the Chicken Flatbread, it was amazing!
Outside it was really hot, but the view was great. You can also sit inside the restaurant.  I am probably in the background of some peoples photos while they were taking pics of that tree lol

I give it 2 stars only because the garden grounds were so lovely. I came here to specifically see if I could recommend this place to a group for a reunion. I would never recommend anyone actually eat here. Food was horrible. Turkey bacon sandwich was dry. It looked good but tasted really bad. The flatbread looked amazing but was also barely edible. Prices were typical for the area. I paid about $13 for each item. Also they do not have gluten free breads or pasta so salad would be your only option.  Pavillion cafe is located between National Archives and the Sculpture Garden.

Located in the National Gallery Sculpture Garden, Pavilion Cafe offers truly tasty cuisine in a beautiful setting. I ordered the superb quiche lorraine which was perfectly bacon-filled and cheesy with a buttery crust. On good weather days you can eat outdoors looking at all the fascinating sculptures. The Pavilion Cafe is a laid back option to the hectic cafes and restaurants in the nearby museums, and the perfect excuse to visit the sculpture garden.

It was the only place open near the museums that is not a food truck.  The meal is box salads and sandwiches.  Very good large size.  Also, carbonated  drinks and beer.   Indoor and outside seating.  Nice fountains with modern art right by it and lots of concrete seats around the water to eat your food.  It closes at 4 pm and opens at 11 am.   Love the structure of the building and no masks needed.

Entire order was incorrect. Ordered one small mocha latte, one chocolate pastrie and one large cinnamon cappuccino. Received 2 small cappuccino filled with 2 inches left. No pastrie. It was a hassle to get the order corrected.

No options for kids on the menu. We are big Moes fans and this place is below standards. Employees were not helpful I would even go as far as calling them rude. It's in a food court so please pass thos place by and try somewhere else. We ended up at the Potbellys next door they were very friendly.

The food was fantastic! I got a salad and they had fried tofu! The salsa is also so good.
—I really enjoyed the green salsa (seemed to almost have a pesto taste). A bit on the expensive side , but that’s to be expected for the area.

We(a group of five) stopped in after a long day of traveling and found ourselves very hungry. We split apart and tried many different orders within the food court but by far, Moe's Southwest Grill was the groups determined favorite. The staff was friendly, and the food was great.

This place is open later than most in the area. For that alone, 5 stars. Also, good food for a Moe's and definitely better than Chipotle. Very friendly staff (but I might not be the best to judge because I'm from NYC where everyone is always angry and mean - especially fast food workers).

Moe's is good fast Mexican food, but this location gives smaller than average portions and seems a little dirty.  You also don't get the traditional "Welcome to Moe's" when you get in line.  With a little improvement they could be much better.

name: Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Washington D.C.
vicinity: 425 7th Street NW at, E Street Northwest, Washington

reviews.text: The portion size of this place is HUGE! Good thing is they serve lunch sizes all day for certain items. Lasagna wasn’t one of those so this was definitely dinner and lunch for the next day. Food wasn’t bad, however, you could taste that everything basically comes from a can. Taste a lot like chef boyardee. Drinks were a bit too sweet but not terrible. The highlight was their garlic bread! Now that was amazing!!!! I could just sit, eat that, and be extremely satisfied

Looking for an Italian food in the downtown area, and found this decent Italian restaurant. Overall, we had a great dining experience. The server was very friendly and professional, she started by explaining a few things about the restaurant and told us that the food is supposed to be shared by 2-3 people per portion. Foods taste great and the price is reasonable.

Conveniently located family share style Italian restaurant. Made a reservation for 8 and they accommodated an unexpected add on with no issue through the reservation system. Was seated promptly with drinks and food served very quickly. Probably best garlic bread I've ever had. Drinks were delicious and strong. Tried a variety of dishes with the huge servings. Very comfortable setting and could easily hear everyone at the table even with it being busy and lively music being played. Would like to go back as soon as possible.

Great food, however for less than 3 or 4 people not well suited. The only regular tables are available for a menu that only serves family-sizes. So if you go there alone as I did, you either have tons of leftovers or ruin every diet you’re on - also, whatever you order apart from drinks comes multiplied by 4 basically and costs accordingly. So ordering a simple garlic bread sets you back 15 USD and you get like 9 pieces. No issue if you sit at the bar to get human-sized portions, however it tainted the experience a little. Nonetheless, the food was gorgeous and the staff great!

Excellent Italian restaurant! We had a great dining experience. The server was very friendly and professional, she started by explaining a few things about the restaurant and told us that the food is supposed to be shared by 2-3 people per portion. Foods taste great and the price is reasonable.

name: Subway
vicinity: 1101 4th Street Southwest 4th Street Bldg, Unit 130, Washington

reviews.text: This is the best Subway I have been to in almost a decade and this includes international locations. They actually include ingredients in their sandwiches instead of just the meat and cheese.  And the family that runs the location are extremely friendly. Just love their vibe and sandwich artistry!

This subway was clean and they had all the meat and extras advertised. I wish they had more baked lays options instead of just regular. The service was good but there was a little wait to check out at the register.

Very Convenient spot on 4th street. First thing I noticed was that the restaurant is immaculate. Everything very clean and in order. Greeted with a hello. Best of all the sub was very good. I had a steak, egg and cheese on Italian herbs and cheese bread. No complaints here.
Thank you so much for filling our order for two sandwiches to go when we came in almost at closing time after tonight’s show at Arena Stage!
Great staff, clean, and awesome location so close to the metro.

Strange cafeteria style process.  Select dessert first, then soup or salad, then go to bar with check sheet to order entree.

Soup good. Entree a minimal sized appetizer that server brings to your table was hot and OK.. Dessert cake was not fresh/ hard and server replaced.
Overall food OK but not dinner size portions, and hi price for what you get. Then expected to bus own table.

So great to have a place we can grab a quick bite before a show if we're running late. The space is fabulous. Love the rock garden in the middle and how they sometimes decorate it to a theme. I had the chicken marsala which was good. Came with green beans and sweet potato, all good. It's not a fancy restaurant by any means but fulfills it's purpose beautifully.

Took the family to see Ann for my mom's 85th birthday.  Play was great, but Richard's place was a huge disappointment. Staff was incredibly rude to everyone in line; they gave incorrect information about simple ingredients like tomato regarding a food allergy; the hot entrees were served cold and tasted terrible.  As others noted the only decent food was the desert.

Ok. Seriously disappointed with Richard’s Place for their Brunch Prix-Fixe.  For the price, it is a rip off. I’ve seen elementary school cafeterias that had better food.  Choice and quality is ridiculous. They ought to just make it free to senior citizens as a benefit to attending a show, since they might’ve the only ones that found it to be any good.  On the flip side of the menu there were a la carte choices. Dramatic cuisine?  Please. Dream on. This is a lovely space but it’s wasted on service for cafeteria food.  The ultimate was you don’t even get coffee.  You have to pay for it.  I get the alcohol cash car. But yours a brunch that doesn’t serve coffee with your brunch. What sounded like a good idea to do before a matinee on a Sunday turns out to be a mood killing experience.  And one piece of sausage or bacon and eggs rationed out....I can’t even.

If I could give this zero stars I would.  You should advertise more realistically for this place.  Unless there are plans to do something better with this space, I’m not telling anyone to do it. Horrible!

I would give this place one star but I cant! The food was disgusting except for the cookies and baked mac and cheese and on top of that the crew had such an attitude for zero reason! Only one employ (black woman with half shaved head) had a good attitude and personality this one star is for her.

A Starbucks review really hinges on three things, the drink, the people, and the place.

This location gets 5 stars for my drink today. Fast delivery to the counter (I always order inside) and it was put together well - tight lid, hot beverage sleeve thingy, and no spills and stuff on the outside of the cup (hate that). I ordered my drink extra hot and I got what I asked for.

The team was working really well together and the short line showed that. Fine job. Extra points for a really friendly staff here.

The place is Starbucks upgraded- not just the standard furniture and fixtures and they have nice outside seating here.  Nice place.  Parking near here is going to be a challenge though.  Restroom was clean and in good order.

Very well done here today SBX. thanks.

What a cool Starbucks! Obviously, amazing location at the wharf but on top of that it has unique seating and a cool vibe. There’s a stage (for live music, I presume?) and lots of comfortable seating indoors and tons of outdoor seating as well. Will definitely be back to this one!

I would describe this Starbucks as slow, inefficient, and having a lack of customer service. People were waiting for 10-15 for regular and ice coffees. They were sitting drinks down without calling out names and 3 employees were just talking behind the counter while I was standing there waiting to order. The reasons for 2 stars is when we finally got our order they tasted good.

Great Starbucks !!
Location is very convenient. It's welcoming, batista are friendly and drinks are perfect.
I loved the atmosphere. It was comfortable and modern.

I've been going to this store for about 3 weeks now. There are some great associates working here but unfortunately there are some others that aren't great at all. For instance I went there on Sunday evening and the cashier was super slow. So I said something about it to my friend who was with me at that time. However, that was not really the issue, the issue is that this cashier tried to be funny and wrote my name wrong on purpose even the barista noticed that and called him out on that one. He grinned and said yes I know I did it on purpose... I don't think that was funny at all so I asked him what was my name to which he replied with my correct name. I do like this store and I tip every time because I feel for them. I tip for their hospitality. There are two cashiers that are awesome! (Two Ladies in morning time, I don't remember their names, though if you've been there before then you know who I'm talking about). I don't mean for this guy to get fired or anything but I strongly believe that he should be disciplined to align his behavior according to Starbucks standards or be moved to a different station where his behavior doesn't affect the guest experience. (The cashier spoke Spanish) but we kept the conversation in English, of course.

Very nice Store with friendly staff and a great menü. We are from Germany and stayed in the region for work and went there every day for coffee and breakfast. Beside the american breakfast they have a lot of healthy add ons and possibilities. Also the quality of the food was very good. its a compfy nice athmoshere and we always felt very Welcome. The Time we stayed there it was our favourite breakfast place ~

Routinely, the Atrium Cafe is a great place and I have visited it often as I work in the area. I primarily visit it for breakfast related items. Unfortunately, today I ran into something I felt needs to be at least mentioned in a review. I have seen, and at times have had, fresh baked items from this location - but this morning the cinnamon roll was clearly old when I went to have it a short bit ago. Displaying and selling old bakery items as fresh is so below the level of service I expect from here, it became noteworthy in a negative way. I would not say avoid this cafe based on this, but be wary and perhaps check (or ask!) the bakery items before you leave the location. They usually do better, and I have come to expect quality bakery items, FRESH ones.
I love this place. Sandwiches are the best around. Get there before noon though...it fills up quickly (because the sandwiches are so good!)
A great small sandwich shop in SW. Open at 6:30 for breakfast and a great choice for lunch quick sandwiches. You might find a line but it moves pretty quick.

I like their meat portions on our meal. They are generally generous with it. The location is great from my workplace. The guy at the registrar is generally cool and friendly. There's long line sometimes during the peak lunch hours but that's normal for any place. The employees sometimes could be difficult to understand due to the language barrier but overall a great Cafe for brunch and lunch.

Always busy at lunch, but they get everyone through the line quickly. Generally friendly service with tasty subs and salads. Helps if you know what you want because sometimes when it’s busy they’ll start taking orders several customers deep into the line.
Decent sandwiches, soups, and lunch type foods. Conveniently located right by Federal Center SW Metro station, very close to Congressional and other buildings downtown. Service was ok.

Horrible experience! Poor customer service! First and LAST time at this restaurant at this location.  Not if other places treat customers poorly like this place. People seemed that don’t care about working there. No “good vibes” as they have printed on their sack lunch.  No substitutions were made to provide a full meal. Menu items were missing with the order. No apologies or any substitutions were offered.

My English it’s not the best of the world. But if you talk with an angry person that could be a problem. It’s my first time in potbelly and assh*** person treat us like shi** just cuz he does not like his job …… :@
Sandwhich artists are top of the line 👌🏼 it’s nice to see friendly crew members who know how to work well together and have fun.

Roti recently made a poorly thought-out, poorly-executed change to online orders. It used to be that all sauces were served on the side with online orders. This makes sense, because it keeps the meal from being soggy, and allows customers to choose how much of each sauce they would like to use.

Without any notice to customers, Roti unilaterally decided that all sauces will now go directly in the bowl. The online ordering system offers no option for on the side, or control over how much sauce you want. Customer service tells me this was to reduce waste. They also said I should put "sauces on the side" in the pickup notes.

Well, I've tried that, and it didn't work. TWICE. The second time was after I complained to customer service about the first time not working. I don't blame this location -- pickup notes are not meant to be notes to the kitchen. I doubt Roti corporate trained their kitchen staff to look for notes -- they just decided everyone will get sauces directly in the bowl and like it, no consumer choice.

I also tried waiting in the torturously slow line to have my meal made in-house, but they shot the sauces in the bowl so freaking fast that I still got too much. I could not tell them to stop soon enough. It seems that Roti is determined to over-dress their meals.

I will not remove this one-star review until sauces on the side with online orders are restored. If you want to give customers the eco-friendly choice, do what Sweetgreen did and BUILD THAT IN TO ONLINE ORDERING. Sweetgreen took their time to test the process of offering mixed salads, and notified customers of the change. And my choices are always respected, because they did it right. Roti did not do it right. Corporate should be ashamed.
This was the worst Mediterranean food ever! The chicken was dry, sweet potatoes weren’t good and they small portions. No pride was taken by the staff.

Unfortunately the quality has gone down, probably due to cost cutting. Their sides used to be very good like the broccoli and carrot. Now, it’s just shredded carrot. Chicken used to be better also.

I’ll still come here however, just not with the same gusto.

I had roti Mediterranean food today. This is one of my favorite to eat. I love their different sauces like red sung, green sung, hummus, garlic and tahini. This is one the good lunch for vegetarian lover. This one also comes with rice and pitas bread that makes dish complete. If someone like pickle then this restaurant has lots option in that.

I like to visit this frequently.

Delicious, fresh and healthy Mediterranean foods! I walked 17 minutes to eat this. Michael was friendly and conscientious. He gave me this beautiful tasty bowl of chicken roti. I wish they open a branch in Washington State

The food was good and the service was quick. I ordered the Ruben with Tater Tots and my friend ordered the Chicken Cesar Wrap with Sweet Potato Fries. We both had coffee to drink and the bill including tip was around $20 per person. They had a nice selection of draft beers but unfortunately I was still too hungover to try any.

The restaurant vibe was just hands down so laid back and kind! Super nice people. Great great great food! Better than most other things I’ve been having in DC! Definitely recommend if you like a laid back pub/bar feel with awesome food and plenty of drinks for ya!
Great service, food was tasty. Very accommodating. Walked here from the National Galary of Art on a Saturday evening and was very satisfied with our experience.

The burgers were overrated IMO. I got the Rodeo and my companion got the Flamethrower. My burger tasted like an overpriced Carl's Jr burger minus the mayo. Overall it was dry, it had generic BBQ sauce on the bottom bun. The top bun had nothing on it. I had to ask for mayo and more bbq sauce. The portion is decent, and I did appreciate that they give you several options for sides without an additional cost. We tried the tater tots and sweet potato fries. They were good. And they also have a decent selection of beers. The seating is crowded inside, and they sat us right in front of the main entrance hallway where there's very dim lighting and everyone passes through. Our 'waiter' might have been the bartender or bus boy, bc he didn't have the same color shirt as the other guy, and had a very dry attitude, no customer service whatsoever.

Came into town last night , and tried this place it was close by, the meat was good on the Reuben but nothing to write home about, the service on the slow Tuesday was something else , waiting 15 minutes for my server to refill a drink. The food was average. Most likely wouldn’t come back here . The drinks also way over priced.

name: Starbucks
vicinity: The Portals, 1201 Maryland Avenue Southwest, Washington

reviews.text: Conveniently located near the capitol mall. The store was a little bit messy when we arrived in the morning with some trash on the floor. Bathrooms were pretty clean. The baristas were friendly and were very quick with the orders!

Sometime only small moves makes a huge difference. Visiting from Toronto stopped by to get our coffee after a good 4 hours walk/ride. Chance  the gentleman in the picture offered free cake pops to my kids as a welcome to Washington. He is truly a customer service ambassador and I wish him all the very best ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

This outlet is brilliant.
It helps us jet lagged travellers have a shot of coffee before the day starts.
The staff are very friendly, helpful and welcoming.
Will probably visit every morning during my stay.
Cheers guys.

I love a peach green lemonade.
I ordered here and it wasn't what i always ordered. I was in shocked. It was boiled water with 2 bags of the green tea and peach tranquility (missing the lemonade).
I do not recommend this location.
Great staff! Super patient (it took us a good 5 min to order!). Then they even brought our drinks and pastries to our table! Great service!
